Feature.Name: Damage Absorption
Feature.Text: You have resistance against all the mask’s damage types (Acid, fire, lightning, poison and cold). If you already have resistance to a damage type from another source, you instead have immunity to that damage type. If you already have immunity to that damage type from another source, whenever you are subjected to damage of that type, you take none of that damage and regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt of that type.

BonusFeature.Name: Draconic Majesty
BonusFeature.Text: While you are wearing no armor, you can add your Charisma bonus to your Armor Class.

Feature.Name: Dragon Breath
Feature.Text: If you have a breath weapon that requires rest to recharge, it gains a recharge of 6.

VisionFeature.Name: Dragon Sight
VisionFeature.Text: You gain darkvision out to 60 feet, or to an additional 60 feet if you already have that sense. Once per day, you can gain blindsight out to 30 feet for 5 minutes.

LanguageProficiencyFeature.Name: Dragon Tongue
LanguageProficiencyFeature.Text: You can speak and understand Draconic. You also have advantage on any Charisma check you make against dragons that share the mask’s color.

ResourceFeature.Name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
ResourceFeature.Text: If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.

Feature.Name: Lingering Shock
Feature.Text: If you deal lightning damage to a creature, it can’t take reactions until its next turn.

Feature.Name: Dragon Fire
Feature.Text: If you deal fire damage to a creature or ﬂammable object, it starts burning. At the start of each of its turns, a creature burning in this way takes 1d6 fire damage. A creature that can reach the burning target can use an action to extinguish the fire.

Feature.Name: Winter’s Fury
Feature.Text: While your current hit points are equal to or less than half your hit point maximum, you deal an extra 1d8 cold damage with your melee attacks.

MagicProperty.Name: Mask of the Dragon Queen
MagicProperty.Description: Individually, the five dragon masks resemble the dragons they are named for. When two or more of the dragon masks are assembled, however, they transform magically into the Mask o f the Dragon Queen. Each mask shrinks to become the modeled head of a chromatic dragon, appearing to roar its devotion to Tiamat where all the masks brought together are arranged crown-like on the wearer’s head. Below the five masks, a new mask shapes itself, granting the wearer a draconic visage that covers the face, neck, and shoulders. While you are attuned to and wear this mask, you can have any of the properties from any one mask. Additionally, you gain the Damage Absorption from each of the five dragon masks, and you gain five uses of the Legendary Resistance property.
